channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Achilles, Neural Network to Predict the Gold Vs US Dollar Integration with Trading Bot for Automatic Trading
item.description: We present Achilles, with a classical architecture of LSTM(Long Short Term Memory) neural network this model is able to predict the Gold vs USD commodity.

item.title: Mitigating Unauthorized Speech Synthesis for Voice Protection
item.description: With just a few speech samples, it is possible to perfectly replicate a speaker's voice in recent years, while malicious voice exploitation (e. g., telecom fraud for illegal financial gain) has brought huge hazards in our daily lives.

item.title: Autoformalize Mathematical Statements by Symbolic Equivalence and Semantic Consistency
item.description: Autoformalization, the task of automatically translating natural language descriptions into a formal language, poses a significant challenge across various domains, especially in mathematics.

item.title: Trajectory Flow Matching with Applications to Clinical Time Series Modeling
item.description: To address this, we propose Trajectory Flow Matching (TFM), which trains a Neural SDE in a simulation-free manner, bypassing backpropagation through the dynamics.

item.title: Hacking Back the AI-Hacker: Prompt Injection as a Defense Against LLM-driven Cyberattacks
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) are increasingly being harnessed to automate cyberattacks, making sophisticated exploits more accessible and scalable.

item.title: NeuZip: Memory-Efficient Training and Inference with Dynamic Compression of Neural Networks
item.description: However, the model sizes are constrained by the available on-device memory during training and inference.

item.title: A Comparative Study of Multiple Deep Learning Algorithms for Efficient Localization of Bone Joints in the Upper Limbs of Human Body
item.description: This paper provides a detailed comparative study between diverse Deep Learning (DL) models - YOLOv3, YOLOv7, EfficientDet and CenterNet in multiple bone joint detections in the upper limbs of the human body.

item.title: Geo-FuB: A Method for Constructing an Operator-Function Knowledge Base for Geospatial Code Generation Tasks Using Large Language Models
item.description: To address this, a retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) approach, utilizing an external knowledge base of geospatial functions and operators, is proposed.

item.title: LARP: Tokenizing Videos with a Learned Autoregressive Generative Prior
item.description: By incorporating the prior model during training, LARP learns a latent space that is not only optimized for video reconstruction but is also structured in a way that is more conducive to autoregressive generation.

item.title: KD-LoRA: A Hybrid Approach to Efficient Fine-Tuning with LoRA and Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated remarkable performance across various downstream tasks.

item.title: NewTerm: Benchmarking Real-Time New Terms for Large Language Models with Annual Updates
item.description: Despite their remarkable abilities in various tasks, large language models (LLMs) still struggle with real-time information (e. g., new facts and terms) due to the knowledge cutoff in their development process.

item.title: A Simple Yet Effective Corpus Construction Framework for Indonesian Grammatical Error Correction
item.description: How to efficiently construct high-quality evaluation corpora for GEC in low-resource languages has become a significant challenge.

item.title: Vision Search Assistant: Empower Vision-Language Models as Multimodal Search Engines
item.description: To address this limitation, we propose Vision Search Assistant, a novel framework that facilitates collaboration between VLMs and web agents.

item.title: Skinned Motion Retargeting with Dense Geometric Interaction Perception
item.description: Subsequently, we develop a novel spatio-temporal representation called the dense mesh interaction (DMI) field.

item.title: SPOTS-10: Animal Pattern Benchmark Dataset for Machine Learning Algorithms
item.description: Recognising animals based on distinctive body patterns, such as stripes, spots, or other markings, in night images is a complex task in computer vision.

item.title: Segmenting Watermarked Texts From Language Models
item.description: Our objective is to develop a statistical method to detect if a published text is LLM-generated from the perspective of a detector.

item.title: BLAST: Block-Level Adaptive Structured Matrices for Efficient Deep Neural Network Inference
item.description: Large-scale foundation models have demonstrated exceptional performance in language and vision tasks.

item.title: ODRL: A Benchmark for Off-Dynamics Reinforcement Learning
item.description: We consider off-dynamics reinforcement learning (RL) where one needs to transfer policies across different domains with dynamics mismatch.

item.title: FusedInf: Efficient Swapping of DNN Models for On-Demand Serverless Inference Services on the Edge
item.description: Edge AI computing boxes are a new class of computing devices that are aimed to revolutionize the AI industry.

item.title: RecFlow: An Industrial Full Flow Recommendation Dataset
item.description: Industrial recommendation systems (RS) rely on the multi-stage pipeline to balance effectiveness and efficiency when delivering items from a vast corpus to users.

item.title: AutoRAG: Automated Framework for optimization of Retrieval Augmented Generation Pipeline
item.description: Using LLMs (Large Language Models) in conjunction with external documents has made RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) an essential technology.

item.title: uOttawa at LegalLens-2024: Transformer-based Classification Experiments
item.description: Our results were 86. 3% in the L-NER subtask and 88. 25% in the L-NLI subtask.

item.title: GenUP: Generative User Profilers as In-Context Learners for Next POI Recommender Systems
item.description: Traditional POI recommendation systems often lack transparency, interpretability, and scrutability due to their reliance on dense vector-based user embeddings.

item.title: Improving Detection of Person Class Using Dense Pooling
item.description: To further improve the performance of person detection we have conducted a different approach which gives the state-of-the-art conclusion.

item.title: CODES: Benchmarking Coupled ODE Surrogates
item.description: We introduce CODES, a benchmark for comprehensive evaluation of surrogate architectures for coupled ODE systems.

item.title: Retrieval-Enhanced Mutation Mastery: Augmenting Zero-Shot Prediction of Protein Language Model
item.description: Enzyme engineering enables the modification of wild-type proteins to meet industrial and research demands by enhancing catalytic activity, stability, binding affinities, and other properties.

item.title: $\texttt{skwdro}$: a library for Wasserstein distributionally robust machine learning
item.description: We present skwdro, a Python library for training robust machine learning models.

item.title: Long-Tailed Out-of-Distribution Detection via Normalized Outlier Distribution Adaptation
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel approach, namely normalized outlier distribution adaptation (AdaptOD), to tackle this distribution shift problem.

item.title: Shopping MMLU: A Massive Multi-Task Online Shopping Benchmark for Large Language Models
item.description: Shopping MMLU consists of 57 tasks covering 4 major shopping skills: concept understanding, knowledge reasoning, user behavior alignment, and multi-linguality, and can thus comprehensively evaluate the abilities of LLMs as general shop assistants.

item.title: Learning to Handle Complex Constraints for Vehicle Routing Problems
item.description: Vehicle Routing Problems (VRPs) can model many real-world scenarios and often involve complex constraints.

item.title: Improving Visual Prompt Tuning by Gaussian Neighborhood Minimization for Long-Tailed Visual Recognition
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel method called Random SAM prompt tuning (RSAM-PT) to improve the model generalization, requiring only one-step gradient computation at each step.

item.title: Introducing Spectral Attention for Long-Range Dependency in Time Series Forecasting
item.description: To overcome these limitations, we introduce a fast and effective Spectral Attention mechanism, which preserves temporal correlations among samples and facilitates the handling of long-range information while maintaining the base model structure.

item.title: FACTS: A Factored State-Space Framework For World Modelling
item.description: World modelling is essential for understanding and predicting the dynamics of complex systems by learning both spatial and temporal dependencies.

item.title: SeriesGAN: Time Series Generation via Adversarial and Autoregressive Learning
item.description: Current Generative Adversarial Network (GAN)-based approaches for time series generation face challenges such as suboptimal convergence, information loss in embedding spaces, and instability.

item.title: Robustness and Generalization in Quantum Reinforcement Learning via Lipschitz Regularization
item.description: We show that training with RegQPG improves the robustness and generalization of the resulting policies.

item.title: Neural Hamilton: Can A.I. Understand Hamiltonian Mechanics?
item.description: We propose a novel framework based on neural network that reformulates classical mechanics as an operator learning problem.

item.title: CardiacNet: Learning to Reconstruct Abnormalities for Cardiac Disease Assessment from Echocardiogram Videos
item.description: To address this issue, we propose a novel reconstruction-based approach named CardiacNet to learn a better representation of local cardiac structures and motion abnormalities through echocardiogram videos.

item.title: Neuro-symbolic Learning Yielding Logical Constraints
item.description: Neuro-symbolic systems combine the abilities of neural perception and logical reasoning.

item.title: MrT5: Dynamic Token Merging for Efficient Byte-level Language Models
item.description: Models that rely on subword tokenization have significant drawbacks, such as sensitivity to character-level noise like spelling errors and inconsistent compression rates across different languages and scripts.

item.title: Semantic Component Analysis: Discovering Patterns in Short Texts Beyond Topics
item.description: Topic modeling is a key method in text analysis, but existing approaches are limited by assuming one topic per document or fail to scale efficiently for large, noisy datasets of short texts.

item.title: Graph-based Uncertainty Metrics for Long-form Language Model Outputs
item.description: Recent advancements in Large Language Models (LLMs) have significantly improved text generation capabilities, but these systems are still known to hallucinate, and granular uncertainty estimation for long-form LLM generations remains challenging.

item.title: Enhancing Action Recognition by Leveraging the Hierarchical Structure of Actions and Textual Context
item.description: In this study, we present a novel approach to improve action recognition by exploiting the hierarchical organization of actions and by incorporating contextualized textual information, including location and prior actions to reflect the sequential context.

item.title: Generative Simulations of The Solar Corona Evolution With Denoising Diffusion : Proof of Concept
item.description: The solar magnetized corona is responsible for various manifestations with a space weather impact, such as flares, coronal mass ejections (CMEs) and, naturally, the solar wind.

item.title: Implementation and Application of an Intelligibility Protocol for Interaction with an LLM
item.description: Here, we address this shortcoming for the case in which one of the agents acts as a ''generator'' using a large language model (LLM) and the other is an agent that acts as a ''tester'' using either a human-expert, or a proxy for a human-expert (for example, a database compiled using human-expertise).

item.title: FuseFL: One-Shot Federated Learning through the Lens of Causality with Progressive Model Fusion
item.description: In this work, we provide a causal view to find that this performance drop of OFL methods comes from the isolation problem, which means that local isolatedly trained models in OFL may easily fit to spurious correlations due to the data heterogeneity.

item.title: Depth Attention for Robust RGB Tracking
item.description: RGB video object tracking is a fundamental task in computer vision.

item.title: Learning from Response not Preference: A Stackelberg Approach for LLM Detoxification using Non-parallel Data
item.description: We model the fine-tuning process as a Stackelberg game between an LLM (leader) and a toxicity screener (follower), which is a binary style classifier (toxic or non-toxic).

item.title: TrajAgent: An Agent Framework for Unified Trajectory Modelling
item.description: In TrajAgent, we first develop UniEnv, an execution environment with a unified data and model interface, to support the execution and training of various models.

item.title: Referring Human Pose and Mask Estimation in the Wild
item.description: We introduce Referring Human Pose and Mask Estimation (R-HPM) in the wild, where either a text or positional prompt specifies the person of interest in an image.

item.title: ANOMIX: A Simple yet Effective Hard Negative Generation via Mixing for Graph Anomaly Detection
item.description: ANOMIX is (a) A first mixing approach: firstly attempting graph mixing to generate hard negatives for GAD task and node- and subgraph-level contrasts to distinguish underlying anomalies.
